thread.title: DIARY-Emerging Markets Economic Events to July 27
thread.title_full: DIARY-Emerging Markets Economic Events to July 27 | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: DIARY-Emerging Markets Economic Events to July 27
text:
July 14 (Reuters) -
For other diaries, please see:
Top economic events
Government debt auctions
Political and general news events
Index of all diaries
Guide to economic indicators
** This Diary is filed daily ***
TUESDAY, JULY 14
JAKARTA - Indonesia central bank board of governors meeting. SANTIAGO - Central bank of Chile interest rate decision - 2100 GMT. SEOUL - South Korea Finance Minister Choi Kyung-hwan will attend a cabinet meeting - 0100 GMT. SOFIA - The Bulgarian parliament will vote to choose a new central bank governor at an extraordinary meeting - 0800 GMT.
WEDNESDAY, JULY 15
SEOUL - South Korea's Finance Minister Choi Kyung-hwan and his vice ministers will attend a meeting of parliament's sub-committee for finance and strategy regarding the supplementary budget - 0100 GMT. ACCRA - Bank of Ghana interest rate decision - 1130 GMT.
THURSDAY, JULY 16 SEOUL - South Korea's Finance Minister Choi Kyung-hwan will attend a meeting of parliament's budget committee regarding the supplementary budget - 0100 GMT.
MONDAY, JULY 20 ABUJA - Central bank of Nigeria holds monetary policy meeting (to July 21).
TUESDAY, JULY 21
BUDAPEST - Central bank of Hungary to hold monthly rate-setting meeting - 1200 GMT. PRETORIA - The South African Reserve Bank starts its three-day monetary policy committee meeting (to July 23). BANGKOK - Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda speaks at the Cambridge Society of Thailand - 1315 GMT.
THURSDAY, JULY 23
PRETORIA - South African Reserve Bank interest rate decision - 1300 GMT. MEXICO CITY - Central bank of Mexico publishes monetary policy statement - 1400 GMT.
MONDAY, JULY 27
JERUSALEM - Bank of Israel interest rate decision - 1330 GMT.
